EM.content: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being, l’homme reste le lien ou le fil conducteur paléonymique that ties analytic of Dasein to totality of metaphysical tradition
EM.linkedContent: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being, l’homme reste le lien ou le fil conducteur paléonymique that ties analytic of Dasein to totality of metaphysical tradition

EM.content: “on voit donc que le Dasein, s’il n’est pas l’homme, n’est pourtant pas autre chose que l’homme”
EM.linkedContent: “on voit donc que le Dasein, s’il n’est pas l’homme, n’est pourtant pas autre chose que l’homme”

SEC.content: deconstruction overturns (renversement), displaces, by means of double writing, double science, double gesture; field of oppositions that it criticizes [sic] can also be nondiscursive
SEC.linkedContent: deconstruction overturns (renversement), displaces, by means of double writing, double science, double gesture; field of oppositions that it criticizes [sic] can also be nondiscursive

SEC.content: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force)
SEC.linkedContent: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force)

VM.content: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space
VM.linkedContent: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space

S.content: [re: Gespräch btwn Heidegger & Trakl] the circle via death, via decline, via West that returns to most originary not analogous to circles/revolutions in Marx and Hegel, so “circle, decline, West,” in Heidegger, are paleonyms, receive quotation marks to lead us elsewhere
S.linkedContent: [re: Gespräch btwn Heidegger & Trakl] the circle via death, via decline, via West that returns to most originary not analogous to circles/revolutions in Marx and Hegel, so “circle, decline, West,” in Heidegger, are paleonyms, receive quotation marks to lead us elsewhere

OH.content: paleonyms: “identity,” “culture,” “Europe,” “capital” > take them very seriously, cautiously, lightly, only in quotation marks
OH.linkedContent: paleonyms: “identity,” “culture,” “Europe,” “capital” > take them very seriously, cautiously, lightly, only in quotation marks

VP.content: we can only deconstruct plunged in inherited concepts, groping toward unnameable
VP.linkedContent: we can only deconstruct plunged in inherited concepts, groping toward unnameable

VP.content: what “begins” “beyond” absolute knowledge: unheard-of thoughts, sought across the memory of old signs
VP.linkedContent: what “begins” “beyond” absolute knowledge: unheard-of thoughts, sought across the memory of old signs

PAS.content: science is a dissimulation of tout autre, philosophy also > Blanchot keeps “old name” to attempt to give an account of this
PAS.linkedContent: science is a dissimulation of tout autre, philosophy also > Blanchot keeps “old name” to attempt to give an account of this

PAS.content: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas
PAS.linkedContent: formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas

PPHS.content: “why?” still metaphysical name of question asking about the metaphysical system which links sign to [concept-truth-presence-archeology-teleology]
PPHS.linkedContent: “why?” still metaphysical name of question asking about the metaphysical system which links sign to [concept-truth-presence-archeology-teleology]

F.content: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology
F.linkedContent: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology

POOF.content: Schmitt’s use of Latin & Greek (hostis/inimicus, polémios/ekhthrós), as a search for the ‘right name’ (question always that of the ‘right name,’ as Nietzsche would say)
POOF.linkedContent: Schmitt’s use of Latin & Greek (hostis/inimicus, polémios/ekhthrós), as a search for the ‘right name’ (question always that of the ‘right name,’ as Nietzsche would say)

WM.content: “we are unwitting metaphysicians in proportion to the usure of our words”
WM.linkedContent: “we are unwitting metaphysicians in proportion to the usure of our words”

P.content: [Kant on paleonym]: use Latin—shelter in hermetic vault to avoid fashion, vulgarity
P.linkedContent: [Kant on paleonym]: use Latin—shelter in hermetic vault to avoid fashion, vulgarity

POS.content: Heidegger recognized that economically/strategically he had to borrow language of metaphysics, as one always must do at moment one deconstructs this language
POS.linkedContent: Heidegger recognized that economically/strategically he had to borrow language of metaphysics, as one always must do at moment one deconstructs this language

POS.content: re: concept “history,” must use double gesture: can’t strike name from vocabulary, must overturn traditional concept & mark interval, so that interval is not simply reappropriated
POS.linkedContent: re: concept “history,” must use double gesture: can’t strike name from vocabulary, must overturn traditional concept & mark interval, so that interval is not simply reappropriated

POS.content: the strategy of paleonomy, of using old name, refers to play of stratagem not hierarchical organization of means & ends: 1) extract predicative trait held in reserve 2) extend, graft, extracted trait, as a lever of intervention, transforming previous organization [writing]
POS.linkedContent: the strategy of paleonomy, of using old name, refers to play of stratagem not hierarchical organization of means & ends: 1) extract predicative trait held in reserve 2) extend, graft, extracted trait, as a lever of intervention, transforming previous organization [writing]

POS.content: Derrida’s texts belong neither to “philosophical” nor “literary” register, communicate w/ other texts that can be called “philosophical” or “literary” acc. a kind of paleonomy
POS.linkedContent: Derrida’s texts belong neither to “philosophical” nor “literary” register, communicate w/ other texts that can be called “philosophical” or “literary” acc. a kind of paleonomy

O.content: paleonymy (keep old word for determined time?): question goes beyond signifier’s simple exteriority to its concept, beyond a fore-knowledge of paleonymic strategy: escape or destroy word in question (i.e. “literature,” “philosophical discourse”) [?]
O.linkedContent: paleonymy (keep old word for determined time?): question goes beyond signifier’s simple exteriority to its concept, beyond a fore-knowledge of paleonymic strategy: escape or destroy word in question (i.e. “literature,” “philosophical discourse”) [?]

O.content: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)
O.linkedContent: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)

O.content: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs
O.linkedContent: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs

O.content: repetition w/out identity, one mark inside, the other outside deconstructed system: double reading, double writing, double science: structure itself is worked in turn
O.linkedContent: repetition w/out identity, one mark inside, the other outside deconstructed system: double reading, double writing, double science: structure itself is worked in turn

O.content: [summary] must face risk of “old name,” not simply declare freedom of signifier (autonomy of meaning) or go outside (which affirms homogeny of closure, which doesn’t exist) > no concept, no name, no signifier can escape this structure
O.linkedContent: [summary] must face risk of “old name,” not simply declare freedom of signifier (autonomy of meaning) or go outside (which affirms homogeny of closure, which doesn’t exist) > no concept, no name, no signifier can escape this structure

O.content: for Hegel, necessity of preface belongs to Bildung, external necessity of concept’s self-presentation, must take time into account as the existence (Dasein) of concept [legibility]
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, necessity of preface belongs to Bildung, external necessity of concept’s self-presentation, must take time into account as the existence (Dasein) of concept [legibility]

O.content: why introduction, for Hegel, is necessary, whereas preface is not: opens a particular philosophical science > Hegel touches on paleonymy
O.linkedContent: why introduction, for Hegel, is necessary, whereas preface is not: opens a particular philosophical science > Hegel touches on paleonymy

O.content: business (l’affaire) of old name, of onymism in general, of false identity of mark, which dissemination must disturb (doit perturber) at the root [re: “Mallarmé,” guise of homonymy]
O.linkedContent: business (l’affaire) of old name, of onymism in general, of false identity of mark, which dissemination must disturb (doit perturber) at the root [re: “Mallarmé,” guise of homonymy]

SW.content: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere
SW.linkedContent: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere

RGE.content: since Hegel’s [all] logic is an interpretation, is submitted to an interpretive decision, it can be interpreted against him > reinterpretation: simulated repetition of Hegelian discourse
RGE.linkedContent: since Hegel’s [all] logic is an interpretation, is submitted to an interpretive decision, it can be interpreted against him > reinterpretation: simulated repetition of Hegelian discourse

RGE.content: minute displacement disjoints articulations, trembling spreads out—old shell cracks
RGE.linkedContent: minute displacement disjoints articulations, trembling spreads out—old shell cracks

RGE.content: Bataille’s sliding occurs at point, place in pattern, where old word, because of placement, slides—making entire discourse slide > violent, strategic twisting (imprinted upon language), inflects old corpus: relates its syntax to a major silence, to the privileged moment of the sovereign operation > “even if it took place only once”
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille’s sliding occurs at point, place in pattern, where old word, because of placement, slides—making entire discourse slide > violent, strategic twisting (imprinted upon language), inflects old corpus: relates its syntax to a major silence, to the privileged moment of the sovereign operation > “even if it took place only once”

RGE.content: opposition of continuous & discontinuous constantly displaced from Hegel to Bataille > for Bataille, continuum of sovereign communication in night of secret difference; for Hegel, conciliate desire for recognition (breaking of secrecy) w/ discontinuity, negativity
RGE.linkedContent: opposition of continuous & discontinuous constantly displaced from Hegel to Bataille > for Bataille, continuum of sovereign communication in night of secret difference; for Hegel, conciliate desire for recognition (breaking of secrecy) w/ discontinuity, negativity

RGE.content: displacement does not transform nucleus of predicates (all the attributes of sovereignty are those of lordship)
RGE.linkedContent: displacement does not transform nucleus of predicates (all the attributes of sovereignty are those of lordship)

RGE.content: Bataille carried away in his calculable sliding > concepts become nonconcepts, unthinkable, untenable
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille carried away in his calculable sliding > concepts become nonconcepts, unthinkable, untenable

RGE.content: phenomenological epochē a reduction carried out au nom et en vue du sens> Bataille proposes epochē of epoch of meaning
RGE.linkedContent: phenomenological epochē a reduction carried out au nom et en vue du sens> Bataille proposes epochē of epoch of meaning

RGE.content: inscription of relation btwn discourse & sovereign operation: “scientific” > a science made to tremble in absolute nonknowledge, “science” only in a transgressed closure—avec un non-savoir absolu sur le sans-fond duquel s’enlèvent la chance ou le pari de sens, de l’histoire et des horizons de savoir absolu
RGE.linkedContent: inscription of relation btwn discourse & sovereign operation: “scientific” > a science made to tremble in absolute nonknowledge, “science” only in a transgressed closure—avec un non-savoir absolu sur le sans-fond duquel s’enlèvent la chance ou le pari de sens, de l’histoire et des horizons de savoir absolu

RGE.content: Bataille’s writing relates all philosophemes (semantemes) to sovereign operation, à la consumation sans retour de la totalité du sens—acknowledges the rule that constitutes what it will deconstitute
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille’s writing relates all philosophemes (semantemes) to sovereign operation, à la consumation sans retour de la totalité du sens—acknowledges the rule that constitutes what it will deconstitute

RGE.content: Bataille keeps [guards] traditional names but they’re struck (affecte) w/ the differences btwn major/minor, archaic/classic [see pp. 337-08n], only way w/in discourse to mark that which separates discourse from its excess
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille keeps [guards] traditional names but they’re struck (affecte) w/ the differences btwn major/minor, archaic/classic [see pp. 337-08n], only way w/in discourse to mark that which separates discourse from its excess

RGE.content: this stratagem, the sovereign operation, play w/ syntax, does not subordinate itself to an anticipated discourse
RGE.linkedContent: this stratagem, the sovereign operation, play w/ syntax, does not subordinate itself to an anticipated discourse

RGE.content: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire
RGE.linkedContent: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire

TR.content: event-machine: change very name of what we call “thought” (now a homonym, paleonym)
TR.linkedContent: event-machine: change very name of what we call “thought” (now a homonym, paleonym)

EL.content: [seemingly in vein of deconstruction] Scholem maneuvered, compromised, negotiated w/ significations (concepts/words) he radically contested—while having to use them
EL.linkedContent: [seemingly in vein of deconstruction] Scholem maneuvered, compromised, negotiated w/ significations (concepts/words) he radically contested—while having to use them

LI.content: “classical concept” as target: a tortuous, complex strategy > exploit target against itself by discovering it to be “basis” of an operation directed against itself, or discovering “in it” the cryptic reserve of something utterly different
LI.linkedContent: “classical concept” as target: a tortuous, complex strategy > exploit target against itself by discovering it to be “basis” of an operation directed against itself, or discovering “in it” the cryptic reserve of something utterly different

LI.content: to ignore or pretend to take no account of a tradition, to rest blindly in it, repeat its most problematic gestures
LI.linkedContent: to ignore or pretend to take no account of a tradition, to rest blindly in it, repeat its most problematic gestures

TN.content: Derrida tells Nancy [humorously?] to not let this megalovirus [touch] contaminate you, stop using these words > leave it to the ancestors
TN.linkedContent: Derrida tells Nancy [humorously?] to not let this megalovirus [touch] contaminate you, stop using these words > leave it to the ancestors

AD.content: receiving beyond capacity of “I” > dissymmetrical disproportion marks law of hospitality
AD.linkedContent: receiving beyond capacity of “I” > dissymmetrical disproportion marks law of hospitality

AD.content: Levinas, surprisingly, calls reason this hospitable receptivity (reorients philosophical tradition, which thinks sensibility as passive opposition to reason)
AD.linkedContent: Levinas, surprisingly, calls reason this hospitable receptivity (reorients philosophical tradition, which thinks sensibility as passive opposition to reason)

WOG.content: on the use of Greek words [in Foucault, Heidegger, Kuhn, Holton]: 1) new concept not in everyday language 2) new archeological discovery: restoration 3) authority of rare words
WOG.linkedContent: on the use of Greek words [in Foucault, Heidegger, Kuhn, Holton]: 1) new concept not in everyday language 2) new archeological discovery: restoration 3) authority of rare words

OG.content: differance can only be thought by passing through the ontico-ontological difference, a determination that gets erased by differance: this trick of writing (tour d’écriture) is irreducible [historial question]
OG.linkedContent: differance can only be thought by passing through the ontico-ontological difference, a determination that gets erased by differance: this trick of writing (tour d’écriture) is irreducible [historial question]

OG.content: the hesitation of Heidegger & Nietzsche is not “incoherence,” it is the trembling of deconstruction: deconstruction does not destroy structures from the inside, must inhabit, inhabits most when one doesn’t suspect it > borrow all subversive strategies from old structure
OG.linkedContent: the hesitation of Heidegger & Nietzsche is not “incoherence,” it is the trembling of deconstruction: deconstruction does not destroy structures from the inside, must inhabit, inhabits most when one doesn’t suspect it > borrow all subversive strategies from old structure

OG.content: that deconstruction falls prey (emportée) to its own work is what another person can’t help pointing out w/ zeal (we should be able to formalize this exercise)
OG.linkedContent: that deconstruction falls prey (emportée) to its own work is what another person can’t help pointing out w/ zeal (we should be able to formalize this exercise)

OG.content: Derrida uses word writing in relation to the vulgar concept of writing, which, historically, would have been impossible w/out dissimulation of arche-writing
OG.linkedContent: Derrida uses word writing in relation to the vulgar concept of writing, which, historically, would have been impossible w/out dissimulation of arche-writing

OG.content: concept of experience belongs to metaphysics, can only use it [deconstructively] sous rature, “experience” always a relationship w/ presence [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea… Preface 1]
OG.linkedContent: concept of experience belongs to metaphysics, can only use it [deconstructively] sous rature, “experience” always a relationship w/ presence [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea… Preface 1]

OG.content: still, must exhaust concept experience so as not to fall prey to “empiricism” and “naive” critiques of experience [i.e. for thinkers appealing to experience, must look for experience outside their theoretical system]
OG.linkedContent: still, must exhaust concept experience so as not to fall prey to “empiricism” and “naive” critiques of experience [i.e. for thinkers appealing to experience, must look for experience outside their theoretical system]

OG.content: one can only justify the choice of word trace w/in une topique, it’s an historical calculation & strategy: a # of givens belonging to our discourse have imposed this choice on Derrida > Levinas—trace as absolute past, Heidegger—undermining ontology as presence/full speech, Nietzsche & Freud—Spur, and use of [trace?] in biology > all make enigmatic: propre, proche, presence
OG.linkedContent: one can only justify the choice of word trace w/in une topique, it’s an historical calculation & strategy: a # of givens belonging to our discourse have imposed this choice on Derrida > Levinas—trace as absolute past, Heidegger—undermining ontology as presence/full speech, Nietzsche & Freud—Spur, and use of [trace?] in biology > all make enigmatic: propre, proche, presence

OG.content: unnameable movement of différence-même, I’ve strategically nicknamed (surnommé) trace, reserve, differance > could be called writing only w/in historical closure, w/in limits of science & philosophy
OG.linkedContent: unnameable movement of différence-même, I’ve strategically nicknamed (surnommé) trace, reserve, differance > could be called writing only w/in historical closure, w/in limits of science & philosophy

OG.content: “Hegel,” “Rousseau,” “Leibniz,” “Descartes” neither identities nor causes > name of problems > so long as closure limits our discourse: we will not have other concepts
OG.linkedContent: “Hegel,” “Rousseau,” “Leibniz,” “Descartes” neither identities nor causes > name of problems > so long as closure limits our discourse: we will not have other concepts

OG.content: impossibility of designating supplement escapes metaphysics by a hairsbreadth (par une pointe), “elle doit pour le reste puiser ses ressources dans la logique qu’elle déconstruit”
OG.linkedContent: impossibility of designating supplement escapes metaphysics by a hairsbreadth (par une pointe), “elle doit pour le reste puiser ses ressources dans la logique qu’elle déconstruit”

EU.content: [re: CIPH] reactualizing categories said to be classical by adjusting them to new objects
EU.linkedContent: [re: CIPH] reactualizing categories said to be classical by adjusting them to new objects

SPEC.content: when French Heideggerians translate Abbauen as “to deconstruct,” or when Marx’s aufgelöst is translated as deconstructed: pass off the already-there (déjà-là) of a word as the anteriority of a concept > w/ Marx, “deconstruction” would be limited to “intellectual critique” of superstructures
SPEC.linkedContent: when French Heideggerians translate Abbauen as “to deconstruct,” or when Marx’s aufgelöst is translated as deconstructed: pass off the already-there (déjà-là) of a word as the anteriority of a concept > w/ Marx, “deconstruction” would be limited to “intellectual critique” of superstructures
